title: Financial Planning & Analysis Manager gefunden bei Bristol Myers Squibb
subtitle: Vienna
body:
Über diese Stellenanzeige

Bristol-Myers Squibb is a global Biopharma company committed to a single mission: to discover, develop, and deliver innovative medicines focused on helping millions of patients around the world in disease areas such as oncology, cardiovascular, immunoscience and fibrosis.

 

Join us and make a difference.  We hire the best people and provide them with a work environment that places a premium on diversity, integrity, collaboration and personal development. Through a culture of inclusion, we create a better, more productive work environment. We believe that the diverse experiences and perspectives of all our employees help to drive innovation and transformative business results.

Key Responsibilities and Major Duties:

  • Insightful analysis of business performance, resource allocation and profit planning
  • Coordination & Execution of budgets, projections and strategic plans
  • Anticipation of risks and opportunities as well as proposal for timely remediation
  • Interaction with Corporate, Regional and Local Managements to facilitate strategic decision making
  • Management of monthly closing processes and accurate financial reporting in a timely manner
  • Partnership with cross-functional teams (Commercial/Medical/Market Access) to provide overall brand support and influence business decisions
  • Identification and implementation of innovative process improvements
  • Enhancements of awareness and adherence to local procedures and policies
  • Participating in national and international finance and cross-functional projects

(Disclaimer: The responsibilities listed above are only a summary and other responsibilities will be requirements as assigned)

Skills/Knowledge Required:

  • Finance Degree in Accounting & Business Administration (or CPA equivalent)
  • 5Y work experience in Finance with part/all of that in financial planning
  • Good command of Accounting and understanding of internal controls
  • Knowledge of Hyperion, Oracle; OBIEE is a plus
  • Strong knowledge of MS Office Tools
  • Ability to move forward and adapt in a fast-paced, growing, changing environment
  • Experience working in a cross-functional business and matrix organization
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent interpersonal and presentation/communication skills
  • Fluency in English; German knowledge is a plus
  • Accountability / Urgency / Passion / Innovation / Integrity / Inclusion

Bristol-Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.
